newsitem.title: USA: October Brent crude climbs in late U.S. trading.
newsitem.headline: October Brent crude climbs in late U.S. trading.

text.p: October North Sea Brent crude oil climbed in late U.S. activity, traders said on Thursday.
Two partial cash deals were done at $19.15 a barrel for a total of 200 lots, up seven cents from the close of London's IPE.
Three exchange-for-physical deals traded, two at $19.10 and one at $19.08 for a total of 350 lots.
October cash was pegged at $19.15-19.20 a barrel, a five cent premium over paper, traders said.
September/October Brent changed hands at minus three cents, with the spread pegged at minus four to minus one cent, weaker by a few pennies from the day's earlier level.
October/November was assessed at minus 10 to minus eight cents, while November/December was valued at minus nine to minus seven cents a barrel.
